data.name: Coding Coins
data.description:
# Coding Coins

The local coding competition has the following points system:
- The team that solves a problem gets a coin.
- The first team to solve a problem gets an additional coin.

A contest has 26 problems, labelled ð– , ð–¡, ð–¢, ..., ð–¹ and every time a team solves a problem, a logging mechanism appends the problem label to a string called `problemsSolved`.

After finishing the contest, organizers want to know how many coins should have been given to the teams.

Notice that no team solve a problem twice and some problems may be solved by none of them.

Your task is to determine the total number of coins the teams received given the `problemsSolved` string.

# Example (input -> output)

```
RSR -> 5
A -> 2
ORZ -> 6
ANNNN -> 7
BKPT -> 8
```
